body_text:
Exactly when did Madara come back to life after his defeat against Hashirama? I know that Madara used Transcription Seal: Izanagi to fake his death and came alive after a while. What was the trigger for this jutsu(Izanagi)? If it was his death, immediately he would've come alive after death and Hashirama would've noticed it. 
It is mentioned that he had used this jutsu on his own right eye. How come a dead person's eye is a trigger for his own revival? As I understand, there wont be any movement/thought from a dead person.

When did Uchiha Madara actually bite Hashirama Senju? After reading this question, I realized that the time Madara acquired Izanagi, was the same time he got the DNA of Senju Clan from Hashirama. However, after an extensive review on their fight (Episode 626), I can't see where and when Madara bit Hashirama. It said in the wiki that:  
"...To use Izanagi to its full potential, users must also have the genetic traits of the Senju, who are also descended from the Sage.."
Now, the question is when and where did Madara bite Hashirama?
How come Madara activated Izanagi (I assume on its full potential) just right after he acquired the flesh/blood from Senju?
